# BackButton A smart back button component that intelligently handles navigation history with a fallback to root. ## Features - **Smart Navigation**: Automatically detects browser history and navigates back when possible - **Fallback Handling**: Falls back to a specified route (defaults to '/') when no history is available - **Customizable**: Supports text, variants, and icon customization - **Accessible**: Built with proper ARIA attributes and keyboard navigation ## Basic Usage ## Props Name Type Default Description `fallbackRoute` `string` `'/'` Route to navigate to when history is empty `variant` `'default' \| 'secondary' \| 'outline' \| 'ghost' \| 'destructive'` `'outline'` The visual style variant of the button `size` `'sm' \| 'md' \| 'lg' \| 'icon'` `'icon'` The size of the button `className` `string` - Additional CSS classes
## Smart Navigation Handling The BackButton component intelligently handles navigation: 1. When clicked, it first checks if there's browser history available (`window.history.length > 2`). 2. If history exists, it uses `router.back()` to navigate to the previous page. 3. If no history is available (e.g., user landed directly on the page), it navigates to the `fallbackRoute`. 4. The default fallback route is the root path (`'/'`), but this can be customized via the `fallbackRoute` prop. ```tsx import { BackButton } from "@/delta/components/back-button" export default function BackButtonExample() { return ( // Will go back in history if available, otherwise to /dashboard ) } ``` ## Accessibility The BackButton component follows WAI-ARIA guidelines: - Includes appropriate aria-label (uses text prop if provided) - Maintains keyboard focus management - Provides visual feedback for all interactive states - Uses semantic HTML elements for better screen reader support
